summary: SEO/meta tag testing across all pages. Most features working correctly. One issue found: blog post og:type renders as 'website' instead of 'article' in the DOM despite BlogPostPage.jsx having correct og:type=article - App.js default Helmet og:type=website is overriding the page-level tag.

integration_issues.issue: og:type renders as 'website' instead of 'article' on blog post pages. App.js Helmet has og:type=website which overrides BlogPostPage's og:type=article. In react-helmet-async, the last Helmet in the tree should win, but App.js's value is winning.

test_results.homepage_title: PASS - 'Recalibrate - AI-Powered Health & Chronic Pain Management App'

test_results.partners_page_meta: PASS - og:image, og:site_name, twitter:card all present

action_items: Fix blog post og:type: App.js global Helmet og:type=website is overriding BlogPostPage's og:type=article. One fix is to not include og:type in App.js's default Helmet, and let each page Helmet set it individually. Or ensure BlogPostPage Helmet renders after App.js in the tree order.
critical_code_review_comments: App.js Helmet contains og:type=website as a default. When BlogPostPage renders its own Helmet with og:type=article, the app-level tag wins, resulting in wrong og:type for blog posts. react-helmet-async should allow page-level overrides, but the current setup has a conflict.
context_for_next_testing_agent: All SEO meta tags working except blog post og:type which shows 'website' instead of 'article'. Check if react-helmet-async properly overrides og:type from App.js (global Helmet) with page-level Helmet in BlogPostPage.
